TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content:
That's what I want for years now! And manually manage the wheels. I damaged some brakes because I couldn't.

If you get a flat tire, just go on EVA to fix it instantly

Boring. Should I launch KSP and make something?

Wait a second! I'm already launching an SSTO for testing!

... yeah it takes a while to speed up. Good thing I have kOS.
When I go to type the word "rock" and somehow automatically manage to attach an -et to the end of it.
When you come back to it after almost a year.

When you come back to it after almost a year.

That sounds like you've not been playing enough!

Welcome back!
When your told to look up pictures of dragons and you look up pictures of the dragon crs.
when you have a ksp bookmarks folder and it has 42 pages in it which are all forum pages...

When you think the kerbals are out there Watching You *speeds up* from orbit around kerbin with a giant tarsier space tech telescope with giant lasers that have photons traveling 11x slower than real light and *passes out*
When your girlfriend txt's you and suggests using moar boosters in an attempt to get you awake.

Your obsession spills over into other games.

I have a KSP TF2 spray:
When you look at the moon in the evening sky and think about how you want to play KSP.
When you teach your mom about orbital mechanics while she is watching a tv show and don't even listen.

When your girlfriend txt's you and suggests using moar boosters in an attempt to get you awake.

There's a keeper my friend.

When you teach your mom about orbital mechanics while she is watching a tv show and don't even listen.

^^^^^
I had to write Moon today and caught myself almost writing Mun.

...quickly calculating if a Vega rebuilt made out of a BACC and a RD-10 can make it into orbit. At work.

My calculations said it's close but not enough, KSP proved me wrong. It can make it, but throttle needs to be lower.
You want to suggest a part to somebody, but you cant remember if it is stock, or from one of your many mods (and if its from a mod you have no chance of remembering which one...)
When you read The Martian and think "Jeb would do that" every third page.

You want to suggest a part to somebody, but you cant remember if it is stock, or from one of your many mods (and if its from a mod you have no chance of remembering which one...)

Or in my case, you know every mod and part out there and can find the thread on a 2 minute search.

Or in my case, you know every mod and part out there and can find the thread on a 2 minute search.

Search? I have commonly suggested mods in a bookmark folder.
:: sigh :: My wife is beginning to say I play KSP too much. But I haven't even put a Kerbal on Duna yet!

:: sigh :: My wife is beginning to say I play KSP too much. But I haven't even put a Kerbal on Duna yet!

She's only beginning? You should be fine for quite a while then.

The word dirvorce didn't come up in our house until I was working on my 3 kerbal Eve return mission.

Happy landings!

When you look at the moon in the evening sky and think about how you want to play KSP.

I so completely do that all the time!

She's only beginning? You should be fine for quite a while then.

The word dirvorce didn't come up in our house until I was working on my 3 kerbal Eve return mission.

Happy landings!

lol !
When you get XCOM, look at the folder size (18.5 GB), and the first thought that comes to mind is "How do people with only 32-bit systems play this game?"
